xxl.core.pipes.sources
Class CursorSource<T>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.sources.AbstractSource<T>
          xxl.core.pipes.sources.CursorSource<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Node, Source<T>, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class CursorSource<T>
extends AbstractSource<T>

Source component in a query graph that permits access to an iterator. In other words, this source is based on a user-defined iterator, whose elements will be transferred.
This class realizes the design pattern Adapter.

Intent:
"Convert the interface of a class into another interface clients expect. Adapter lets classes work together that couldn't otherwise because of incompatible interfaces."
For further information see: "Gamma et al.: DesignPatterns. Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software. Addision Wesley 1998."

Example usage (1): 

        new Printer(new CursorPipe(new xxl.cursors.Enumerator(20, 0), 100));
Prints the elements of the Enumerator-Cursor, namely 20, ..., 1, with a delay of 100 milliseconds between two successive ones to the standard output stream.

Since:
1.1
See Also:
Iterator, Cursor, SourceProcessor

Field Detail

cursor

protected Cursor<T> cursor
The cursor providing the elements of this source.

Constructor Detail

CursorSource

public CursorSource(SourceProcessor processor,
                    Iterator<T> iterator)
Creates a new autonomous initial source in a query graph retrieving its elements from the specified iterator. A user-defined processor simulates its activity.
The iterator is wrapped to a cursor.

Parameters:
processor - The thread simulating this source's activity.
iterator - The iterator providing the elements this source will transfer.

CursorSource

public CursorSource(Iterator<T> iterator,
                    long period)
Creates a new autonomous initial source in a query graph retrieving its elements from the specified iterator. The source transfers its elements with a fixed rate.
The iterator is wrapped to a cursor.

Parameters:
iterator - The iterator providing the elements this source will transfer.
period - The delay between two succesive elements in the resulting stream.

          throws SourceIsClosedException
Description copied from class: AbstractSource
Opens this source and starts the thread simulating the source's activity.
Sets the flag isOpenend.

close

public void close()
Closes this source by invoking super.close. After that the cursor is also closed.

Specified by:

See Also:

next

public T next()
       throws NoSuchElementException
Retrieves the next element from the underlying cursor and thus the next element of the source. The implementation is as follows: 

        if (cursor.hasNext())
                return cursor.next();
        throw new NoSuchElementException();

Specified by:
next in class AbstractSource<T>
Returns:
The next element of the underlying cursor.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - If the cursor has no further elements.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
